channel.title: BBC News
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Red Cross says at least 21 killed and dozens shot in Gaza aid incident
item.description: Reports say an incident occurred in Rafah in the early hours of Sunday as people were queueing for aid.

item.title: Hamas makes hostage pledge but demands changes to US Gaza ceasefire plan
item.description: The response is seen as neither an explicit rejection nor clear acceptance of the proposal, but US envoy Steve Witkoff has branded it "unacceptable".

item.title: US sends nuclear deal proposal to Iran
item.description: It comes after the UN nuclear watchdog warned Iran has stepped up its production of enriched uranium.

item.title: Iran significantly growing uranium stockpile, warns UN nuclear agency
item.description: The International Atomic Energy Agency says Iran now possesses over 400kg of uranium at 60% purity.

item.title: Last hospital in North Gaza governorate evacuated after Israeli order
item.description: Al-Awda, the last functioning hospital in the North Gaza governorate, is out of service after the Israeli military ordered its evacuation.

item.title: Gaza subjected to forced starvation, top UN official tells BBC
item.description: Tom Fletcher, the under-secretary general of humanitarian affairs, says "we're seeing food set on the borders and not being allowed in".

item.title: Jailed activist's mother in hospital after resuming hunger strike
item.description: Laila Soueif, the mother of British-Egyptian Alaa Abdel Fattah, is being treated at a London hospital for dangerously low blood sugar.

item.title: Hamas official says it will reject new US Gaza ceasefire plan backed by Israel
item.description: The US says Israel has "signed off" on envoy Steve Witkoff's plan and that it is waiting for a formal response from Hamas.

item.title: Security breaks down in Gaza as desperate people search for food
item.description: Scenes of chaos and looting in parts of Gaza persist as food shortages continue.

item.title: Israel announces major expansion of settlements in occupied West Bank
item.description: The biggest such move in years is condemned by the Palestinian presidency as a "dangerous escalation".

item.title: Gaza warehouse broken into by 'hordes of hungry people', says WFP
item.description: Video footage shows crowds breaking into the warehouse and taking bags of flour and cartons of food.

item.title: Iran investigates case of 'missing' Indian nationals
item.description: The families of the men, who are from Punjab state, allege they have been kidnapped in Iran.

item.title: EU says Israeli strikes in Gaza 'go beyond what is necessary' to fight Hamas
item.description: Kaja Kallas, the EU's top diplomat, says the bloc also does not support a new aid distribution model which bypasses the UN and other humanitarian organisations.

item.title: Israel PM says Hamas's Gaza chief Mohammed Sinwar has been killed
item.description: Mohammed Sinwar was the target of a Israeli strike on the courtyard of the European hospital in Khan Younis on 13 May.

item.title: Dozens injured by Israeli gunfire as crowds overwhelmed Gaza aid site, UN says
item.description: The Israeli military says troops fired warning shots into the air but not at Palestinians during Tuesday's incident in Rafah.

item.title: Hopes of parenthood crushed after IVF embryos destroyed in Israel's Gaza offensive
item.description: Couples in Gaza using IVF to help them conceive “left with nothing” after 4,000 embryos at an IVF clinic were destroyed.

item.title: Crowds overrun US-backed group's new aid distribution site in Gaza
item.description: Videos show people walking over torn-down fences at the Gaza Humanitarian Foundation's site in Rafah.

item.title: 'Situation is dire' - BBC returns to Gaza baby left hungry by Israeli blockade
item.description: Malnourished five-month-old baby Siwar is now out of hospital in Gaza - but as we found, she and her family are struggling.

item.title: Chaos spreads as desperate Gazans wait for food to arrive
item.description: Lawlessness is stopping food from reaching people, while a clash at an aid convoy on Thursday night turned deadly.

item.title: As Israel faces diplomatic 'tsunami', Trump is staying quiet
item.description: This has been a tumultuous week for the Jewish state, the BBC's Paul Adams writes.

item.title: What we know about Israeli embassy staff shooting
item.description: Police say the victims, a young couple, were shot by a man who shouted "free, free Palestine".

item.title: Investigating Israel's strike on Gaza's European Hospital
item.description: BBC Verify analysed footage, gathered witness testimony and spoke to munitions and legal experts to examine how one of Gaza's last functioning hospitals came under Israeli attack.

item.title: Paul Adams: Starmer and Lammy sound genuinely angry at Israel
item.description: The PM sounded genuinely angry at Israel's aid blockade and expanded Gaza offensive, writes diplomatic correspondent Paul Adams.

item.title: Jeremy Bowen: Goodwill running out as UK, France and Canada demand Israel end Gaza offensive
item.description: France, the UK and Canada are among nations that have sharpened their criticism of Israel's ground offensive.

item.title: Did Trump really strike Gulf deals worth $2tn?
item.description: Some analysts question whether the amount of investment will ultimately be that high.

item.title: Trump's frantic week of peace brokering hints at what he really wants
item.description: After seven breathless days of diplomatic hurly burly, we have a clearer idea of the US president's global ideology - and the limits of his 'art of a deal'.

item.title: 'My children go to sleep hungry,' Gazans tell the BBC
item.description: The BBC speaks to people in Gaza during a 10-week blockade on food, medical supplies and other aid.

item.title: BBC joins Gaza children as they are evacuated to Jordan for treatment
item.description: The BBC's Fergal Keane accompanies children being evacuated from Gaza on their journey to Jordan.

item.title: Iran using criminal gangs for hit jobs abroad, court papers show
item.description: Organised gangs are paid to carry out attacks and kidnappings, evidence uncovered by the BBC reveals.

item.title: 'I'm overjoyed to be back': Syrians face daunting rebuild after years of war
item.description: The BBC joins a convoy bringing families back to Homs, which saw some of the fiercest fighting.

item.title: Scared and malnourished - footage from Gaza shows plight of children and aftermath of Israeli strike
item.description: Israel says it targeted top Hamas militants hiding among civilians at the Khan Younis hospital.

item.title: Trump's meeting with Sharaa, unthinkable just months ago, boosts Syrians' hopes
item.description: Syria's interim leader met the US president in Riyadh after he announced he would lift sanctions on Syria.

item.title: 'I've practised being booed', Israel's Eurovision entry who survived Hamas attack tells BBC
item.description: Yuval Raphael, who survived the 7 October attack, says performing her ballad New Day Will Rise is a "personal win".

item.title: ‘Children handcuffed and shot’ – ex-UK Special Forces break silence on ‘war crimes’ by colleagues
item.description: Veterans who served with the SAS and SBS give BBC Panorama eyewitness accounts of alleged executions.

item.title: BBC team's tense encounter with sanctioned Israeli settler while filming in West Bank
item.description: Israeli settler Moshe Sharvit established a so-called 'outpost' in occupied West Bank

item.title: World has responsibility to get aid into Gaza, UN official tells BBC
item.description: The UN's Tom Fletcher tells the BBC the people of Gaza have been subjected to forced starvation by Israel.

item.title: BBC given rare access to search for Hezbollah positions with UN troops in Lebanon
item.description: A Unifil spokesperson said the main violations of a ceasefire deal reached six months ago are from the Israeli side.

item.title: Young girl escapes burning Gaza school after Israeli attack
item.description: Ward Jalal Al-Shaikh Khalil escaped the flames at the school, unaware her mother and two siblings had died in the strike.

item.title: BBC sees Gaza aid going through inspection area at Israeli crossing
item.description: The BBC's Wyre Davies visits the Kerem Shalom crossing, through which aid for Gaza is currently passing after Israel eased an 11-week blockade.

item.title: Witnesses who saw shooter inside Jewish museum speak to BBC
item.description: Witnesses tell the BBC about hearing gunshots and the shooter shouting: 'Free Palestine'.

item.title: British surgeon's 'high anxiety' operating in Gaza
item.description: Dr Rose has been describing life at Nassar Hospital in Gazan city of Khan Younis.
